question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: Thinking about the body as a while system, asking why certain systems respond the way they do, and connecting functions of the body to others

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned about the systems of the body in detail. For example, I learned about the importance of action potentials in all systems of the body, how to read an ECG, and the function of the gallbladder (to store bile). I also learned the functions of many specific negative feedback loops in the body.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned how to effectively take notes from videos and PowerPoints. I found the questions to practice really engaging and helpful. Additionally, I learned how to take what I was learning and apply it to the questions.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned about the mechanics of the heart. The general theory of hormones. And the differences between primary and secondary pathologies.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: This course taught me how to apply the lessons I learned on a clinical level, making me think more creatively about my learned concepts. I also learned much about the complicated molecular details contributing to our basic human functions. Finally, I gained knowledge from my classmates during group discussions, which was very informative.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned a lot of the function and biology behind human physiology and function of the human body.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: While taking the course, I learned that I am a very visual learner. I need to draw diagrams on my notebook to fully understand what I am covering. I also learned to look through the transcript of the videos in case I missed info while taking notes. Another method I used when studying was to look at the bigger picture. Since this class covers many small steps and sections of body systems, it was easy to get overwelmed. Taking a step back to look at the bigger picture helped me understand the function of the topic I was covering.

response_text: The weekly review sessions helped to put together all of the key concepts for each unit

response_text: Dr. Carbrey was very engaging and was welcoming to students that needed to reach out. I think that the cases are a fun and effective way to practice the material.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: The instructor is extremely accommodating and kind. Although I was busy with many other things this summer, I still received all the support I needed to succeed in all of my endeavors. Dr. Carbrey was very responsive to emails, answered in less than 24 hours, and was extremely understanding of other summer plans, which I greatly appreciated.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: The course covered many topics that I had not gone over in any of my high school classes. To get past my limited knowledge, I had to put lots of time and energy into the class. I developed new ways to learn topics and asked many questions. This made it very stimulating.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: The class is super interesting but there is a lot of content so it is best to consolidate information frequently

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: It is important to stay on top of the lectures and not get behind. I recommend taking notes, not just watching the videos. It is also important to engage with the other students and be sure you are not letting your teammates do all of the work.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: Definitely take it! The professor is extremely knowledge and kind to all of her students. I learned a lot!

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: if you are able to, take the course, Professor Carbrey is wonderful.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: I would say the course can be challenging and time consuming if you take lots of notes from the video (I used multiple notebooks), but the class is worth it if you like enjoying about the human body.
